items.title: Federal Judge Bars Some Warrantless Immigration Arrests in D.C.
items.summary: The judge found that immigration agents were likely acting illegally when making arrests without a warrant.

items.title: Trump to Close Voice of America’s Overseas Offices and Radio Stations
items.summary: The push to close the offices appears to contradict a federal judge’s order from April, which required Trump officials to resume operations at V.O.A.

items.title: Matt Van Epps Wins Tennessee House Race After a Trump-Led Rescue Mission
items.summary: Matt Van Epps fended off a Democrat to protect Republicans’ slim House majority, but the relatively close margin in a red district sent the party a warning shot before the 2026 midterms.

items.title: U. of Alabama Suspends Black and Female Student Magazines, Citing D.E.I. Guidance
items.summary: Officials told staff members at two student-run publications, called Nineteen Fifty-Six and Alice, that they were not compliant with Attorney General Pam Bondi’s memo on diversity programs.

items.title: Trump’s Shift on Afghan Immigrants
items.summary: Zolan Kanno-Youngs, a White House correspondent, describes how President Trump’s latest immigration restrictions, after the shooting of two National Guard members by a man whom the authorities described as an Afghan national, affect a community that traditionally has been considered an exceptional case.

items.title: Trump Appears to Fight Sleep During Cabinet Meeting
items.summary: President Trump began the meeting by criticizing media coverage about him showing signs of fatigue. Last month, he appeared to doze off during a meeting in the Oval Office.

items.title: Pete Hegseth says he ‘didn’t stick around’ to watch second strike on alleged drug boat as Democrats slam administration over attacks – as it happened

items.title: Republican Matt Van Epps wins US House special election in Tennessee
items.summary: <p>Van Epps defeats Aftyn Behn in congressional election closely watched for signs of Republican weakness</p><p>Republican Matt Van Epps defeated Democrat Aftyn Behn in a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/01/tennessee-democrats-congressional-race">congressional special election</a> in the western Nashville suburbs, which was being closely watched for signs of Republican weakness going into congressional midterms next year.</p><p>The Associated Press called the race at 9.47 EST with Van Epps holding a 52% to 46% lead.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/02/tennessee-special-election">Continue reading...</a>
